svg.text:
title: "Week in Eth News
October 25, 2020" date: "2020-10-25"
Eth News and Links
Eth1
* Latest Turbogeth weekly release
* Sponsored transaction precompile draft
* Piper’s state availability doc
Proof of Stake launch
* Deposit contract at least 2 weeks away , pending audit report of blst BLS sig
library
* Context: Justin Drake writes the history of BLS sigs and Eth2
* Mass-slashable unavailability faults
Layer2
* StarkWare’s plans for layer2 interoperability , aiming at q1 2021
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Celer !
Celer is a coherent layer-2 scaling platform on Ethereum powered by Generalized State
Channel Network and Hybrid Rollup technology. Real money games, such as Arcade Win and
Daub Cash , built using Celer's gaming-focused SDK just reached top #10 ranking in App
Store. We have completed the last State Guardian Network testnet and will be launching
SGN on mainnet soon.
Follow us on twitter , blog , discord and telegram .
Stuff for developers
* Solidity v0.7.4 bugfix when copying empty byte arrays from memory/calldata to
storage
* B̶u̶i̶d̶l̶e̶r̶ is now Hardhat ; much easier mainnet forking, better support for
multiple solc versions in production
* Tenderly’s deep integration with Hardhat , with accompanying guide
* Truffle v5.1.50 , now with web3js v1.2.9
* Chainlink VRF now providing randomness on mainnet
* Prestwich’s memview-sol : memory access with runtime typechecking in Solidity
* Falsehoods that Ethereum devs believe
* Detecting ownership takeovers using Mythril
* Trail of Bits intern on using n-grams in SlithIR and machine learning on their audit
reports ; data prep is hard!
* A story of saving 200m in DeFi cover from getting bricked
* How Argent upgraded to Solidity v0.6
* 3box’s IDX , an SDK for decentralized identities (DIDs)
* A more gas efficient version of WETH
* Autoconnect your Unity game to MetaMask
* Learning Solidity for attorneys
* Austin Griffith’s eth.build course for web devs new to eth on BlockGeeks
Ecosystem
* Ethereum is on pace to settle over 1 trillion USD in 2020 eth tx volume
* Mamba : Cicada 3301 for web3
* Vitalik’s round 7 gitcoin matching review
* Some Medalla data challenge submissions: Splunk dashboard with health score Some
whale data viz over time Elias Simos and Sid Shekhar plethora of stats
* Splunk dashboard with health score
* Some whale data viz over time
* Elias Simos and Sid Shekhar plethora of stats
Enterprise
* Provide and Unibright merging into a “ low-code, end-to-end Baseline integration
suite ”
* Baselining the end consumer , how people use mainnet without knowing it
* Villanova sending private Ethereum chain into space on a satellite
* Interact with the chain using Curvegrid’s Google Sheets add-on
Application layer
* Defi now has a yield curve: Yield Protocol is live with beta launch. Fixed-term,
fixed-rate lending/borrowing, or add liquidity. Quick visualization of the yield curve
* Quick visualization of the yield curve
* pooltogether v3 is live, removed admin control, randomness via VRF, rewards for
deposits and referrals
* Novel Air Pollution Measurement System on Ethereum
* a synthetic token for impermanent loss via prediction market
* DeFiSaver’s loan shifter to easily move between protocols and assets
* Opolis Employment Commons unveils tokenization system for processing payroll or
getting health insurance through the commons
* Music streaming platform Audius on mainnet ; airdrop to 10k most popular artists
Regulation/business/tokens
* Federal bank regulator Brian Brooks compares banks in the age of DeFi to the post
office in the age of email
* Kik settles with the SEC by paying $5m and freezing their 3 trillion tokens
* de la Rouviere: seasons & longevity of community tokens
* web3 ownership will eat the software that’s eaten the world
General
* PayPal adds ETH and BTC in the US, held by Paxos. Venmo to follow.
* GridPlus’s Lattice1 hardware wallet ships pre-orders
* Reason’s cypherpunk series, video 3
* Build a high performance fuzzer with GPUs for 10x performance in the cloud
Job Listings
* Want a new challenge? mStable seeks experienced Smart Contract/Protocol Dev
* DeFi devs! Yield is hiring for Solidity and front-end – contact@yield.is
* 0x hiring a Matcha marketing manager and all flavors of developers
* Chainlink has 30+ openings at the moment across marketing, ops, & devs
* Trail of Bits hiring blockchain security engineers & cryptography analyst
* Celer hiring Solidity and Go devs. Email: hiring@celer.network
Want your job listing here ? $250 per line (~75 character limit including spaces),
payable in ETH (or 250 DAI or 250 USDC) to evan.ethereum.eth. Questions?
thecryptonewspodcast at-gmail
Wanton self-promotion section
If you’re wondering “ why didn’t my post make it into Week in Ethereum News ,” then
please put it on an Ethereum subreddit; emails/DMs are not part of my workflow.
Please click the following if you’re interested in sponsoring the newsletter .
Follow the newsletter on twitter: @WeekinEthNews
Permalink for this week’s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-eth-news-october-25-2020/
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note ( new/changes in bold ) :
* Oct 29 - ETHBKK
* Oct 30 - Ethereum’s Impact on the World - ETHOnline summit
* Oct 31 - submission deadline for Underhanded Solidity Contest
* Nov 6-7 - virtual Trufflecon
* Nov 16 - MetaMask Provider breaking changes
* Nov 19 - EthBerlin 2.5: Talk Show
* Dec 3 - Ethereum in the Enterprise - Asia Pacific
Did you get forwarded this newsletter? Sign up to receive it weekly
Week in Ethereum News
